abstract: Indonesian Security Min Luhut B Pandjaitan says country has ruled out criminal investigation of atrocities committed during anti-Communist purges carried out by soldiers and military-backed civilian, paramilitary and religious groups from 1965 to 1966.
lead_paragraph: An official said that the government would, over time, try to answer how hundreds of thousands were killed in state-sponsored violence from 1965 to 1966.

headline.main: Indonesia Rules Out Criminal Inquiry of Anti-Communist Purges
headline.print_headline: Indonesia Rules Out Criminal Inquiry of Atrocities in Anti-Communist Purges

snippet: An official said that the government would, over time, try to answer how hundreds of thousands were killed in state-sponsored violence from 1965 to 1966.
